author: @static75
text: Two questions:  1)  At 4:42 in your video, you can see that the background starts to slowly and automatically adjust after you repositioned the camera. When I run this code, the original frame tends to stay locked-in, regardless of how long I let it run.  How did you get background to dynamically adjust and "fade out"?   Question 2)  Even this apparent fade-out is still not 100% adjusted to the new camera angle.  Take a closer look at your right hand at 5:02.  The "fg" image clearly shows a line through your right hand when there is actually nothing there - it's just a wall.  This line comes from the very first image that was captured.  So... how do you get the MOG to constantly refresh what the "background" reference image is?

author: @MultiJoniboy
text: in case you are getting the error: "Segmentation fault" : instead of "True" you need to use "cap.isOpened()" as parameter of the while loop. if "cap.isOpened()" returns "False" and therefore the while loop doesn't start in the first place it is a problem with OpenCV. You will find the solution to this Problem in the StackOverflow question named: "OpenCV 2.4 VideoCapture not working on Windows"
